search_results.title: Wham!'s 'Last Christmas' Is U.K.'s Christmas No. 1 for 2024
search_results.text:
[×](https://www.billboard.com/www.billboard.com)

[Skip to main content](https://www.billboard.com/www.billboard.com#pagetop)

WHAM!’s Andrew Ridgeley with his Official Christmas Number 1 award 2024 from the Official Charts Company. Courtesy Photo

### Trending on Billboard

It’s official: [Wham!](https://www.billboard.com/artist/wham)’s “Last Christmas” is the [U.K.’s Christmas No. 1](https://www.officialcharts.com/charts/singles-chart/) for 2024.

search_results.title: Another Christmas Number 1 for WHAM!
search_results.text:
News
[![Wham! Last Christmas](https://cdn-p.smehost.net/sites/005297e5d91d4996984e966fac4389ea/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/Wham-Last-Christmas.png)](https://www.sonymusic.co.uk/another-christmas-number-1-for-wham/)
# Another Christmas Number 1 for WHAM!
December 20, 2024
In the year of its 40th anniversary, George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley’s ‘Last Christmas’ has taken the top spot in the UK’s Official Christmas Number 1 single chart, for the second year running. Making history, as the first song to clinch two consecutive Christmas Number 1s.
Speaking to Official Charts, WHAM!’s Andrew Ridgeley said: “37 years to get to Number 1, 39 years to Christmas Number 1, and then like London buses they all come along at once! I’m especially pleased for George, he would have been utterly delighted, his fabulous Christmas composition has become such a classic, almost as much a part of Christmas as mince pies, turkey and pigs in blankets. It’s testament to a really wonderful Christmas song that in

search_results.title: Last Christmas becomes first song to be Christmas number 1 ...
search_results.text:
Wham! have made chart history as Last Christmas becomes the first song to be crowned Christmas number one two years in a row.

Hear from Andrew Ridgeley on the accolade and the proudness George Michael would have felt.

## What you need to know about Christmas number ones
**The festive season is firmly upon us, with bands and artists across the land competing for the crown of Christmas number one.**
There's been 73[Christmas](https://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/articles/zdjjf4j)number ones to date, with a 74th well on the way to celebrate this year's yuletide tunes. Now, not every Christmas number one has been a[Christmas song](https://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/articles/zngxywx), some of them don't even seem like proper songs at all - but what was Christmas number one the year you were born?
Well, here at BBC Bitesize, we've put

search_results.title: List of UK Albums Chart Christmas number ones
search_results.text:
[Jump to content](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#bodyContent)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

[The Beatles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles) have released seven Christmas number one albums, more than any other act.

The [UK Albums Chart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_Albums_Chart) is a weekly [record chart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Record_chart) based on sales of [albums](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albums) in the United Kingdom; the term "Christmas number ones" refers to the records that are at the top of the chart on [Christmas Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas_Day). Typically, the Christmas number one is the album that was announced as number one on the Sunday before 25 December. When Christmas Day falls on a Sunday itself, the official number one is the one announced on that day's chart.[\[1\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1) As of December 2023[\[update\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_UK

metadata.title: In which decade will the 2025 UK Christmas number one have been originally released?
metadata.description:
Since 1952, the [UK singles chart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_singles_chart) has tracked the top-selling singles in the United Kingdom. Though the chart runs year-round, [over time](https://www.history.co.uk/articles/the-history-of-christmas-number-ones) attention came to be paid to the [top-selling single around Christmas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UK_singles_chart_Christmas_number_ones), which is now announced by BBC Radio 1 on the Friday before Christmas.

For most of its history, the Christmas number one was a recently released song, sometimes on the topic of Christmas and sometimes not. Then from 2005 through 2008, the winner of that year's [X Factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor_\(British_TV_series\)) reached number one each year. This bothered people, and in 2009, a successful campaign was launched to get another song, Rage Against the Machine's [Killing in the Name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_in_the_Name#2009_UK_Christmas_number_one_campaign), from 1992, to the top of the charts instead. However the next several years saw a return to current releases, including a few more wins by X Factor winners.

In 2018, The X Factor went off the air, and the top position that year was taken by [LadBaby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LadBaby), a British YouTuber who then claimed the top spot in 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022 and who consequently now holds the record for most Christmas number ones of all time (surpassing The Beatles). However in 2023, LadBaby stopped releasing Christmas songs, and with [no one stepping up the fill the gap](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cvg6ejq7zpyo), Wham!'s classic [Last Christmas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_Christmas), from 1984, took the top position in both 2023 and 2024.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":39845,"question_id":39390}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the decade of the original release of the [2025 UK Christmas number one](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UK_singles_chart_Christmas_number_ones).
